subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 18 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Blades remain bullish on tribunal
Chairman Kevin McCabe is hopeful Sheffield United can overturn their relegation from the top flight after the first day of an arbitration tribunal.



 
Uefa probes England & Serbia U21
Uefa opens disciplinary proceedings against Serbia & England after incidents in the European Under-21 Championship tie.



 
Totti scoops European Golden Boot
Roma striker Francesco Totti wins the European Golden Boot after scoring 26 times last season.








GOLF




Cabrera disbelief at US Open win
Argentine Angel Cabrera says he has exceeded his expectations by winning the US Open at Oakmont.



 
Cool Cabrera wins US Open classic
Argentina's Angel Cabrera beats Jim Furyk and Tiger Woods by one shot to win a thrilling US Open.



 
Second place is never fun - Woods
Tiger Woods is disappointed with a second consecutive second-place finish at a major at the US Open.








MOTORSPORT




Prost warns McLaren over tactics
Alain Prost says McLaren's decision to give Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso equal status could work against them.



 
Hamilton shocked by early success
Lewis Hamilton admits he is stunned by his brilliant start in Formula One after victory at the US Grand Prix.



 
Superb Hamilton takes US victory
Lewis Hamilton produces another incredible performance in Indianapolis to claim his second successive Grand Prix victory.








FORMULA ONE




Prost warns McLaren over tactics
Alain Prost says McLaren's decision to give Lewis Hamilton and Fernando Alonso equal status could work against them.



 
Hamilton shocked by early success
Lewis Hamilton admits he is stunned by his brilliant start in Formula One after victory at the US Grand Prix.



 
Superb Hamilton takes US victory
Lewis Hamilton produces another incredible performance in Indianapolis to claim his second successive Grand Prix victory.








ATHLETICS




Devonish best dashed by mistake
Marlon Devonish could see his 100m personal best removed from the records because of an administrative mistake in Oslo.



 
Idowu shines in Golden League win
Phillips Idowu beats the world's best triple jumpers to claim the opening Golden League meeting in Oslo.



 
Yelling withdraws from GB squad
Liz Yelling pulls out of the GB marathon squad for this summer's World Athletics Championships in Osaka.








CYCLING




Moreau secures Dauphine victory
Frenchman Christophe Moreau wins the Dauphine Libere after a rain-hit final stage is won by Alexandre Vinokourov.



 
Unibet blasts cycling 'scandal'
An online gaming firm says a decision to ban the cycling team it sponsors from the Tour de France is a "scandal".



 
Moreau into lead as Iglinsky wins
Frenchman Christophe Moreau leads the Dauphine Libere after the sixth stage is won by Kazakhstan's Maxim Iglinsky.








FUN AND GAMES




Angel delight
Robbo on why it cheers him to see out-of-shape sportsmen winning trophies



 
Review of the week
Michael Vaughan hits the town as Messi keeps his hand in
